definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: And work hard, I think he will go far.
sentences.chinese: 工作又勤快，我看他保准大获成功。

sentences.english: You’re sure to have interrupted sleep if you’re constantly getting up to go to the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 否则，保准您要不断起身去卫生间而影响您的睡眠。

sentences.english: If You Go Out With Wet Hair, You’ll Catch a Cold.
sentences.chinese: 湿着头发跑，保准得感冒？

sentences.english: It's not safe to gamble on the train arriving late.
sentences.chinese: 指望这次列车晚点，是很不保准的。

definition: certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
it'd be a wonder if... (following a verb phrase that is usually negative)
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
to avoid/so as to save (money or time)
lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
pinyin: chi1 bu5 liao3 dou1 zhe5 zou3
